borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development fails to&nbsp;respect the character and appearance of the existing dwelling by presenting harmfully disproportionate development to the original dwelling house.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size:14.6667px">Furthermore, as a result of the positioning of the proposed side extension, the ground floor rear windows and door would not receive adequate natural light and would therefore generate negative implications to current and future living conditions. The proposed development would therefore be contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:14.6667px">National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:14.6667px">Policies 7.4, 7.5 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:14.6667px">Policy D4 and D8 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:14.6667px">Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:14.6667px">Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:14.6667px">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:14.6667px">Policies SP4, SP8, DM11 and DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019).</span></li></ul><p><br></p>

The proposed development, due to its scale and siting, would reduce outlook from the neighbouring properties and result in overshadowing and overlooking of the garden, detrimental to the residential amenity of the occupant(s) of this property and contrary to policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document and the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document.
description: ERECTION OF TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION; PART SINGLE PART TWO STOREY REAR EXTENSION, AND DEMOLITION OF THE EXISTING GARAGE.
